outcome.title: Part B: HAQDI Score Over Time for Participants Who Received at Least One Dose of 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
outcome.description: Health Assessment Questionnaire-Disability Index (HAQ-DI) indicates the extent of participant's functional ability during the past week, and was assessed for subgroup of participants with symptoms of Polymyalgia Rheumatic (PMR). HAQ-DI included 20 questions in 8 categories of functioning - dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and usual activities. Each functional area contains at least two questions. For each question, there is a 4-level difficulty scale that is scored from 0 (minimum) to 3 (Maximum), representing "no difficulty" (0), "some difficulty" (1), "much difficulty" (2), and "unable to do" (3) where, lower score indicates less disability and higher scores indicates worse disability. Total score was calculated as average scores of 20 questions which can be interpreted in terms of 3 categories: from 0 to 1: mild difficulties to moderate disability, from 1 to 2: disability moderate to severe, from 2 to 3: severe to very severe disability
outcome.population: ITT-Part B Population

group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 12-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

measure.title: Part B: HAQDI Score Over Time for Participants Who Received at Least One Dose of 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
measure.description: Health Assessment Questionnaire-Disability Index (HAQ-DI) indicates the extent of participant's functional ability during the past week, and was assessed for subgroup of participants with symptoms of Polymyalgia Rheumatic (PMR). HAQ-DI included 20 questions in 8 categories of functioning - dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and usual activities. Each functional area contains at least two questions. For each question, there is a 4-level difficulty scale that is scored from 0 (minimum) to 3 (Maximum), representing "no difficulty" (0), "some difficulty" (1), "much difficulty" (2), and "unable to do" (3) where, lower score indicates less disability and higher scores indicates worse disability. Total score was calculated as average scores of 20 questions which can be interpreted in terms of 3 categories: from 0 to 1: mild difficulties to moderate disability, from 1 to 2: disability moderate to severe, from 2 to 3: severe to very severe disability
measure.population: ITT-Part B Population

outcome.title: Part B: HAQDI Score Over Time for Participants Who Never Received 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
outcome.description: Health Assessment Questionnaire-Disability Index (HAQ-DI) indicates the extent of participant's functional ability during the past week, and was assessed for subgroup of participants with symptoms of Polymyalgia Rheumatic (PMR). HAQ-DI included 20 questions in 8 categories of functioning - dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and usual activities. Each functional area contains at least two questions. For each question, there is a 4-level difficulty scale that is scored from 0 (minimum) to 3 (Maximum), representing "no difficulty" (0), "some difficulty" (1), "much difficulty" (2), and "unable to do" (3) where, lower score indicates less disability and higher scores indicates worse disability. Total score was calculated as average scores of 20 questions which can be interpreted in terms of 3 categories: from 0 to 1: mild difficulties to moderate disability, from 1 to 2: disability moderate to severe, from 2 to 3: severe to very severe disability
outcome.population: ITT-Part B Population

group.title: PartB:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 milligram (mg) subcutaneously (SC) every 2 weeks (q2w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-months prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+3 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 mg SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 3-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:SIR 50 mg SC q4w+6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 50 mg SC every 4 weeks (q4w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen in Part A

group.title: PartB:Placebo SC q2w + 6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:Placebo SC q2w + 12 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 12-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

measure.title: Part B: HAQDI Score Over Time for Participants Who Never Received 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
measure.description: Health Assessment Questionnaire-Disability Index (HAQ-DI) indicates the extent of participant's functional ability during the past week, and was assessed for subgroup of participants with symptoms of Polymyalgia Rheumatic (PMR). HAQ-DI included 20 questions in 8 categories of functioning - dressing and grooming, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and usual activities. Each functional area contains at least two questions. For each question, there is a 4-level difficulty scale that is scored from 0 (minimum) to 3 (Maximum), representing "no difficulty" (0), "some difficulty" (1), "much difficulty" (2), and "unable to do" (3) where, lower score indicates less disability and higher scores indicates worse disability. Total score was calculated as average scores of 20 questions which can be interpreted in terms of 3 categories: from 0 to 1: mild difficulties to moderate disability, from 1 to 2: disability moderate to severe, from 2 to 3: severe to very severe disability
measure.population: ITT-Part B Population

outcome.title: Part B: Change From Baseline in PtGA Score for Participants Who Received at Least One Dose of 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
outcome.description: The Patient's Global Assessments of Disease Activity was recorded on a Visual analog scale (VAS). of 10 centimeter (cm) ranging from 0 ("very well) to 10 ("very poor"). Baseline was the last measurement done up to and including the Week 52 visit date of Part A. Change from Baseline was defined as post-Baseline value minus Baseline value.
outcome.population: ITT-Part B Population

group.title: PartB:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 milligram (mg) subcutaneously (SC) every 2 weeks (q2w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-months prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+3 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 mg SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 3-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:SIR 50 mg SC q4w+6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 50 mg SC every 4 weeks (q4w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen in Part A

group.title: PartB:Placebo SC q2w + 6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:Placebo SC q2w + 12 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 12-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

measure.title: Part B: Change From Baseline in PtGA Score for Participants Who Received at Least One Dose of 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
measure.description: The Patient's Global Assessments of Disease Activity was recorded on a Visual analog scale (VAS). of 10 centimeter (cm) ranging from 0 ("very well) to 10 ("very poor"). Baseline was the last measurement done up to and including the Week 52 visit date of Part A. Change from Baseline was defined as post-Baseline value minus Baseline value.
measure.population: ITT-Part B Population

outcome.title: Part B: Change From Baseline in PtGA Score for Participants Who Never Received 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
outcome.description: The Patient's Global Assessments of Disease Activity was recorded on a Visual analog scale (VAS). of 10 centimeter (cm) ranging from 0 ("very well) to 10 ("very poor"). Baseline was the last measurement done up to and including the Week 52 visit date of Part A. Change from Baseline was defined as post-Baseline value minus Baseline value. Participants with post baseline data were reported.
outcome.population: ITT-Part B Population

group.title: PartB:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 milligram (mg) subcutaneously (SC) every 2 weeks (q2w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-months prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+3 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 mg SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 3-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:SIR 50 mg SC q4w+6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 50 mg SC every 4 weeks (q4w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen in Part A

group.title: PartB:Placebo SC q2w + 6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:Placebo SC q2w + 12 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 12-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

measure.title: Part B: Change From Baseline in PtGA Score for Participants Who Never Received 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
measure.description: The Patient's Global Assessments of Disease Activity was recorded on a Visual analog scale (VAS). of 10 centimeter (cm) ranging from 0 ("very well) to 10 ("very poor"). Baseline was the last measurement done up to and including the Week 52 visit date of Part A. Change from Baseline was defined as post-Baseline value minus Baseline value. Participants with post baseline data were reported.
measure.population: ITT-Part B Population

outcome.title: Part B: Change From Baseline in PhGA Score for Participants Who Received at Least One Dose of 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
outcome.description: In PhGA was based on "What is physician's assessment of the participant's current disease activity". PhGA used a 10 cm VAS ranging from 0 ("none") to 10 ("extremely active"). Baseline was the last measurement done up to and including the Week 52 visit date of Part A. Change from Baseline was defined as post-Baseline value minus Baseline value.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 0) and Day 85, Day 113, Day 162, Day 203, Day 339, Day 344, Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, Week 14, Week 16, Week 24, Week 36, Week 38, Week 40
outcome.population: ITT-Part B Population

group.title: PartB:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 milligram (mg) subcutaneously (SC) every 2 weeks (q2w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-months prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+3 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 mg SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 3-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:SIR 50 mg SC q4w+6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 50 mg SC every 4 weeks (q4w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen in Part A

group.title: PartB:Placebo SC q2w + 6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:Placebo SC q2w + 12 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 12-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

measure.title: Part B: Change From Baseline in PhGA Score for Participants Who Received at Least One Dose of 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
measure.description: In PhGA was based on "What is physician's assessment of the participant's current disease activity". PhGA used a 10 cm VAS ranging from 0 ("none") to 10 ("extremely active"). Baseline was the last measurement done up to and including the Week 52 visit date of Part A. Change from Baseline was defined as post-Baseline value minus Baseline value.
measure.population: ITT-Part B Population

outcome.title: Part B: Change From Baseline in PhGA Score for Participants Who Never Received 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
outcome.description: In PhGA was based on "What is physician's assessment of the participant's current disease activity". PhGA used a 10 cm VAS ranging from 0 ("none") to 10 ("extremely active"). Baseline was the last measurement done up to and including the Week 52 visit date of Part A. Change from Baseline was defined as post-Baseline value minus Baseline value. Participants with post baseline data were reported.
outcome.population: ITT-Part B Population. Only those participants with data available at the specified time points were analyzed.

group.title: PartB:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+6 Month Prednisone

group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 12-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

measure.description: In PhGA was based on "What is physician's assessment of the participant's current disease activity". PhGA used a 10 cm VAS ranging from 0 ("none") to 10 ("extremely active"). outcome.title: Part B: Number of Participants With PGIC Score Over Time Who Received at Least One Dose of 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
outcome.description: Patient-reported response to treatment was assessed using the PGIC measure, a single item completed by participant to provide a clinically meaningful summary of an individual's response to treatment. The assessment provides an estimate of the magnitude of treatment response at different time points during the study. Responses include: Much Better, Better, Slightly Better, No Change, Slightly Worse, Worse, and Much Worse. The categorical data of participant rating of change is summarized by treatment group, visit and response category.
outcome.population: ITT-Part B Population

group.title: PartB:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 milligram (mg) subcutaneously (SC) every 2 weeks (q2w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-months prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+3 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 mg SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 3-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:SIR 50 mg SC q4w+6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 50 mg SC every 4 weeks (q4w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen in Part A

group.title: PartB:Placebo SC q2w + 6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

group.title: PartB:Placebo SC q2w + 12 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 12-month prednisone taper regimen in part A

The assessment provides an estimate of the magnitude of treatment response at different time points during the study. Responses include: Much Better, Better, Slightly Better, No Change, Slightly Worse, Worse, and Much Worse. The categorical data of participant rating of change is summarized by treatment group, visit and response category.

outcome.title: Part B: Change From Baseline in EQ-5D-5L VAS Over Time for Participants Who Received at Least One Dose of 100 mg OL Sirukumab in Part B
outcome.description: EQ-5D essentially consists of 2 elements: the EQ-5D descriptive system and the EQ VAS. The EQ-5D descriptive system comprised of the following 6 dimensions: 1.Mobility, 2.Self, 3.Usual Activities, 4.Pain/Discomfort, 5.Anxiety/Depression; 6.How good or or bad your health is today. Each of these 6 dimensions has 5 levels: 1: no problems; 2: slight problems; 3: moderate problems; 4: severe problems; 5: Unable to do. The EQ VAS records the respondent's self-rated health on a vertical line, VAS where the endpoints are 'Best imaginable health state' and 'Worst imaginable health state'. Answers to 'How good or bad your health is today' were measured on a 100 point VAS scale. Baseline for Part B is the last non-missing measurement done up to and including the Week 52 visit date of Part A. Change from Baseline was defined as post-Baseline value minus Baseline value.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 0) and Days 85, 87, 91, 113, 162, 339 and 344 and Weeks 12 and 24
outcome.population: ITT-Part B Population

reported_events.time_frame: On-treatment serious Adverse events (SAEs) and non-serious Adverse Events (nSAEs) were collected from the start of study treatment up to Week 52 in Part A and up to Week 120 in Part B.
reported_events.desc: Safety Set was used. Safety Population comprised of all randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of SC Investigational Product.

group.title: Part A:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 milligram (mg) subcutaneously (SC) every 2 weeks (q2w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-months prednisone taper regimen

group.title: Part A:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+3 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 mg SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 3-month prednisone taper regimen

group.title: Part A: SIR 50 mg SC q4w+6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received SIR 50 mg SC every 4 weeks (q4w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen

group.title: Part A:Placebo SC q2w + 6 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen

group.title: Part A:Placebo SC q2w + 12 Month Prednisone
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 12-month prednisone taper regimen

group.title: Part B:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+6 Month Prednisone+100mg OL SIR
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 milligram (mg) subcutaneously (SC) every 2 weeks (q2w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-months prednisone taper regimen in Part A. Participants received at least one dose of 100mg OL SIR in Part B.

group.title: Part B:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+3 Month Prednisone+100mg OL SIR
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 mg SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 3-month prednisone taper regimen in Part A. Participants received at least one dose of 100mg OL SIR in Part B.

group.title: Part B:SIR 50 mg SC q4w+6 Month Prednisone+100mg OL SIR
group.description: Participants received SIR 50 mg SC every 4 weeks (q4w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen in Part A. Participants received at least one dose of 100mg OL SIR in Part B.

group.title: Part B:Placebo SC q2w + 6 Month Prednisone+100mg OL SIR
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen in Part A. Participants received at least one dose of 100mg OL SIR in Part B.

group.title: Part B:Placebo SC q2w + 12 Month Prednisone+100mg OL SIR
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 12-month prednisone taper regimen in Part A. Participants received at least one dose of 100mg OL SIR in Part B.

group.title: Part B:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+6 Month Prednisone/ No 100mg OL SIR
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 milligram (mg) subcutaneously (SC) every 2 weeks (q2w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-months prednisone taper regimen in Part A. Participants never received 100mg OL SIR in Part B.

group.title: Part B:SIR 100 mg SC q2w+3 Month Prednisone/ No 100mg OL SIR
group.description: Participants received SIR 100 mg SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 3-month prednisone taper regimen. Participants never received 100mg OL SIR in Part B.

group.title: Part B:SIR 50 mg SC q4w+6 Month Prednisone/ No 100mg OL SIR
group.description: Participants received SIR 50 mg SC every 4 weeks (q4w) for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 3-month prednisone taper regimen. Participants never received 100mg OL SIR in Part B.

group.title: Part B:Placebo SC q2w + 6 Month Prednisone/ No 100mg OL SIR
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 6-month prednisone taper regimen. Participants never received 100mg OL SIR in Part B.

group.title: Part B:Placebo SC q2w + 12 Month Prednisone/ No 100mg OL SIR
group.description: Participants received placebo SC q2w for 52 weeks plus a pre-specified maximum of 12-month prednisone taper regimen. Participants never received 100mg OL SIR in Part B.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
